alert.note: Alert for North Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 1:48PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Itasca County through 215 PM CDT... At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marcell, or 29 miles north of Grand Rapids, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Itasca County, including the following locations... North Star Lake, Talmoon, Gunn Lake, Balsam Lake, Scenic State Park, Spider Lake and Coon Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
